page.title: 01General-area West of Taunton
page.content: The area is from Norton Fitzwarren in the NE to Bradford-on-Tone in the SW in the valley of the River Tone. The principal interests are farming (arable and dairy and beef cattle). Other employers are Taunton Cider Co., the second largest cider manufacturer in the country, and the CEGB Fideoak Transmission station, which is an important switching station for Hinkley Point and the National Grid. Historical features are the remains of the Grand Western Canal and Norton Station which has been an important junction since the GWR in the last century. Here the West Somerset and North Devon lines (which were closed in 1950's) joined the main line West. Its people are mainly a rural group concerned with agricultural topics politics, flooding, footpaths, and pollution -both visual and ecological.
